```{r}
# Theme: Planet Aurelia
```

## 1.1 Atomic Types

```{r}
# Numeric values
population <- 8.7
temperature <- 23.5
size_km <- 14500
rating <- 9.8

# Integer values
num_moons <- 3L
num_cities <- 25L
num_species <- 350L

# Logical values
has_water <- TRUE
is_inhabited <- TRUE

# Character values
planet_name <- "Aurelia"
region <- "Andromeda"
category <- "Terrestrial"

cat(planet_name, "is a", category, "planet in", region,
    "with population", population, "billion and temperature", temperature, "°C.\n")
```

## 1.2 Vectors

```{r}
num_vector <- c(population, temperature, size_km, rating, num_moons, num_cities, num_species)
seq_vector <- seq(10, 100, by = 5)
logic_vector <- sample(c(TRUE, FALSE), 10, replace = TRUE)

num_vector
seq_vector
logic_vector
```

## 1.3 Matrix

```{r}
planet_matrix <- matrix(sample(-50:50, 9), nrow = 3, ncol = 3)
rownames(planet_matrix) <- c("CityA", "CityB", "CityC")
colnames(planet_matrix) <- c("Temp", "Energy", "Growth")

planet_matrix
rowMeans(planet_matrix)
colMeans(planet_matrix)
```

## 1.4 List

```{r}
planet_list <- list(
  population = population,
  temperature = temperature,
  size = size_km,
  rating = rating,
  moons = num_moons,
  matrix = planet_matrix,
  vectors = list(num_vector, seq_vector, logic_vector),
  description = "Aurelia — a warm, water-rich terrestrial planet in the Andromeda galaxy."
)

planet_list
```

## 1.5 Factor

```{r}
civ_levels <- factor(c("low", "medium", "high", "medium", "high"))
table(civ_levels)
```

## 1.6 Data Frame

```{r}
cities_df <- data.frame(
  name = c("Aqua", "Lumin", "Orion", "Zephyr", "Terra"),
  population = c(120, 90, 300, 50, 200),
  is_coastal = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE),
  category = c("large", "medium", "mega", "small", "large")
)

colnames(cities_df) <- c("City", "Population", "Coastal", "Category")

str(cities_df)
summary(cities_df)

cities_df$Pop_million <- cities_df$Population / 100
cities_df
```
